page.title: 07ECOLOGY IN BURNHAM MARKET
page.content: Burnham Market is designated an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and is on the edge of the Heritage Coastline. The{climate}is drier than that in many other parts of the country (though this is hard to believe in such a wet year as 1985). Chill North and East winds blow across the county from the North Sea - it is said that "The Norfolk wind is lazy: it blows through you instead of round you!" Local farms have a wide selection of{wildlife}- pigeons, rabbits, pipistrelle bats and toads. Bats are a protected species, but the others are considered by farmers to be pests. There are well-maintained{footpaths and bridle paths over much of this area, though one is under dispute at present.
